author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Goshen-born Judih Weinstein, believed to be Hamas hostage, confirmed killed on Oct. 7
text:
Summary by Ground News Orange County native Judih Weinstein Haggai, taken hostage from Kibbutz Nir Oz by Hamas on Oct. 7, was killed that day. The mother of four and grandmother of seven was 70 years old and held U.S., Canadian and Israeli citizenship. Her husband, also a dual Israeli-American citizen, was confirmed dead last week. Both their bodies are believed to still be held by Hamas in Gaza. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
Daily Freeman Center High Factuality Goshen-born Judih Weinstein, believed to be Hamas hostage, confirmed killed on Oct. 7 By THERESA BRAINE | tbraine@nydailynews.com | New York Daily News GOSHEN, N.Y. — Orange County native Judih Weinstein Haggai, taken hostage from Kibbutz Nir Oz by Hamas on Oct. 7 along with husband Gadi Haggai, was killed that day, the kibbutz announced Thursday. The mother of four and grandmother of seven was 70 years old and held U.S., Canadian and Israeli citizenship. She was born in Goshen, N.Y., and grew up in Canada, but had lived in Israe…
